attributes.action: Change the laws concerning Independant Living Fund
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This allowance is supposed to help disabled people buy in extra
care they need to help them stay at home rather than in a
residential home. 
Historically this allowance is granted depending on how much your local authority pays towards care
and not the amount of hours it provides. 
As the north of the country
charges less per hour than in the south this is unfair as
someone for the sake of example who gets as little as 30 hours per week in London can't get any extra help even though it is desperately needed, whereas someone in the North of the country who gets 60 hours per week paid by their local authority can as care is so much cheaper up there. If people cant get help they have to into a residential home which in turn will cost the local authorities and government considerably more.
